content: a lot of thought into your color choices this is meant to feel like a master class in color theory for the knitter who wants to learn more about color but doesn t know where to start if you re feeling overwhelmed by all the possibilities i recommend starting by choosing your contrast colors which is usually the opposite of what i d recommend find a series of colors that speak to you whether from your scrap stash or in a pre-made mini skein kit already designed for you by a yarn dyer like i did then select a main color that will have enough contrast with all of the colors and will complement them i recommend using a photo layout or vision board planning style for this - it ll help you visualize the sweater and get excited without stressing yourself out too much if all else fails you can always use handspun or one single full-sized skein as your contrast color i can see some beautiful fractal variegated or speckled versions in store for some folks lastly take a look at the chart on page 5 to decide how many colors you ll use and how many row in the mc to knit between them based on your cowl circumference no math required here is an excellent article about color theory in knitting by kelsey peterson https //thewoollythistle com/blogs/the-woolly-thistle/color-theory we ll cast on our cowl using a provisional cast-on which allows us to place our cast-on stitches back onto a set of needles later to graft them to the other end of the cowl if you don t know how to do a provisional cast-on don t stress - it s fairly easy to learn here s my favorite tutorial https //www purlsoho com/create/provisional-cast-on-video/ after knitting this cowl is seamlessly joined by grafting together the provisionally cast on stitches to the stitches already on the needles a method sometimes known as kitchener stitch i try to stay away from this term because herbert kitchener the technique s namesake is responsible for committing horrific acts of genocide by implementing scorched earth martial policy and concentration camps in south africa in the early 1900s i use the term grafting throughout this pattern instead i ve included my favorite tutorial below from norman of nimble needles https //nimble-needles com/stitches/how-to-do-the-kitchener-stitch/ abbreviations bobble bind off mc main color bor beginning of round pm place marker cc contrast color rs right side co cast on st s stitch es k knit © ginger dog knits 2024 4 directions getting started finishing using waste yarn and a crochet hook place provisional cast-on sts onto another provisionally co 106 sts dk version or 136 circular needle of the same or smaller size sts fingering weight cable length/needle tip size does not matter as long as it isn t a larger needle tip than the setup round 1 mc pm for bor join in the one you knit the cowl with round and k all sts important
